texts.text:
distance:
 absolute:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 horizontal:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 x:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 y:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 z:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 effects: A list of status effects.
 <minecraft:effect_name>: A status effect with the key name being the status effect name.
 ambient: Whether the effect is from a beacon.
 amplifier: The effect amplifier.
 amplifier:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 duration: The effect duration in ticks.
 duration:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 visible: Whether the effect has visible particles.
 equipment:
 mainhand:
Tags common to all items[show]
 offhand:
Tags common to all items[show]
 head:
Tags common to all items[show]
 chest:
Tags common to all items[show]
 legs:
Tags common to all items[show]
 feet:
Tags common to all items[show]
 flags: Predicate Flags to be checked.
 is_on_fire: Test whether the entity is or is not on fire.
 is_sneaking: Test whether the entity is or is not sneaking.
 is_sprinting: Test whether the entity is or is not sprinting.
 is_swimming: Test whether the entity is or is not swimming.
 is_baby: Test whether the entity is or is not a baby variant.
 lightning_bolt‌[until JE 1.19]: Lightning bolt properties to be checked. Fails when entity is not a lightning bolt.
 blocks_set_on_fire: Number of blocks set on fire by this lightning bolt. Can also be a range with "min" and "max".
 entity_struck: Entity properties of entities struck by this lightning bolt. If present, this tag must match one or more entities.
All possible conditions for entities[show]
 location:
Tags common to all locations[show]
 nbt: An NBT string.
 passenger: The entity directly riding this entity.
All possible conditions for entities[show]
 player‌[until JE 1.19]: Player properties to be checked. Fails when entity is not a player.
 looking_at: The entity that the player is looking at, as long as it is visible and within a radius of 100 blocks. Visibility is defined through the line from the player's eyes to the entity's eyes, rather than the direction that the player is looking in.
All possible conditions for entities[show]
 advancements: A map of advancements to check.
 <advancement id>: An advancement ID.
 <advancement id>:
 <criteria id>: A criteria ID of the advancement.
 gamemode: The game mode of the player. Must be survival, adventure, creative or spectator.
 level: The experience level of the player.
 level:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 recipes: A map of recipes to check.
 <recipe id>: A recipe ID. True if the recipe is known to the player.
 stats: List of statistics to match.
A statistic. Note that unlike when adding scoreboard objectives, the base (for example, minecraft:custom) and the statistic (for example, minecraft:sneak_time) are split and use proper namespaces instead of the dot-notation (minecraft.custom:minecraft.sneak_time).
 type: The statistic base. Possible values are minecraft:custom, minecraft:crafted, minecraft:used, minecraft:broken, minecraft:mined, minecraft:killed, minecraft:picked_up, minecraft:dropped and minecraft:killed_by.
 stat: The statistic ID. Mostly mimics the criteria used for defining scoreboard objectives.
 value: The value of the statistic.
 value:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 stepping_on: Location predicate for the block the entity is standing on.
Tags common to all locations[show]
 team: The team the entity belongs to.
 type: An entity ID.
 targeted_entity: The entity which this entity is targeting for attacks.
All possible conditions for entities[show]
 vehicle: The vehicle that the entity is riding on.
All possible conditions for entities[show]
 fishing_hook‌[until JE 1.19]: The properties of the fishing hook that just got reeled in by the entity.
 in_open_water: Whether the fishing hook was in open water. Open water is defined as a 5x4x5 area around the fishing hook that only has lily pads, air, water source blocks, bubble columns and waterlogged blocks without a collision area.
 catType‌[until JE 1.19]: The cat's variant. This string is a resource location for the texture of the cat's variant.
 type_specific‌[upcoming: JE 1.19]: Tags restricted for specific types of entities.
 type: The type of entity specific data. Can be any, cat, fishing_hook, frog, lightning, player, or slime. The rest of the fields that can be used here depend on this tag.
For type any:
No other fields
For type cat:
 variant: A resource location specifying a cat variant. Can be one of minecraft:all_black, minecraft:black, minecraft:british, minecraft:calico, minecraft:jellie, minecraft:persian, minecraft:ragdoll, minecraft:red, minecraft:siamese, minecraft:tabby, or minecraft:white.
For type fishing_hook:
 in_open_water: Whether the fishing hook was in open water. Open water is defined as a 5x4x5 area around the fishing hook that only has lily pads, air, water source blocks, bubble columns and waterlogged blocks without a collision area.
For type frog:
 variant: A resource location specifying a frog variant. Can be one of minecraft:cold, minecraft:temperate, or minecraft:warm.
For type lightning:
 blocks_set_on_fire: Number of blocks set on fire by this lightning bolt. Can also be a range with "min" and "max".
 entity_struck: Entity properties of entities struck by this lightning bolt. If present, this tag must match one or more entities.
For type player:
 looking_at: The entity that the player is looking at, as long as it is visible and within a radius of 100 blocks. Visibility is defined through the line from the player's eyes to the entity's eyes, rather than the direction that the player is looking in.
All possible conditions for entities[show]
 advancements: A map of advancements to check.
 <advancement id>: An advancement ID.
 <advancement id>:
 <criteria id>: A criteria ID of the advancement.
 gamemode: The game mode of the player. Must be survival, adventure, creative or spectator.
 level: The experience level of the player.
 level:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
 recipes: A map of recipes to check.
 <recipe id>: A recipe ID. True if the recipe is known to the player.
 stats: List of statistics to match.
A statistic. Note that unlike when adding scoreboard objectives, the base (for example, minecraft:custom) and the statistic (for example, minecraft:sneak_time) are split and use proper namespaces instead of the dot-notation (minecraft.custom:minecraft.sneak_time).
 type: The statistic base. Possible values are minecraft:custom, minecraft:crafted, minecraft:used, minecraft:broken, minecraft:mined, minecraft:killed, minecraft:picked_up, minecraft:dropped and minecraft:killed_by.
 stat: The statistic ID. Mostly mimics the criteria used for defining scoreboard objectives.
 value: The value of the statistic.
 value:
 max: The maximum value.
 min: The minimum value.
For type slime:
 size: The size of the slime. Can also be a range with "min" and "max".
